message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE

This paper belongs to the field of natural language processing (NLP) and specifically focuses on creating sentence embeddings for biomedical texts. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also uses advanced deep learning methods, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper evaluates the performance of the embeddings in sentence pair similarity tasks, which could place it in cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the use of over 30 million documents from scholarly articles and clinical notes suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deals with the use of neural networks in various applications.
